results.title: The Laser: a light fantastic
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The laser is a revolutionary invention which produces a useful form of light. The light we usually see is a combination of many frequencies, directions and phases. The laser however, produces coherent light; that is, all the light waves travel simultaneously in exactly the same direction and at exactly the same frequency. One day, laser light may have as many uses as electricity does today. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Standing room only
results.creator_credit: Sidney Meyers, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the implications of the world’s burgeoning population growth depicting ideas for distributing food surpluses, exploiting the oceans, increasing agricultural activity. Examines several of the procedures including birth control whereby this growth can be controlled. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Bats, birds and bionics
results.creator_credit: John MacDonald, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of the principles of natural systems in living animals such as bats, rattlesnakes, frogs and rats, to engineering devices to guide blind persons, self guiding missiles, photoelectric scanners capable of distinguishing shapes and bionic computers designed to learn and to control man-like robots. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Autos, autos everywhere
results.creator_credit: Philip Burton, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The redesign, computerization and possible elimination of automobiles in the next century is predicted in this film. Experimental models using new power sources, and the trend towards taking responsibility away from human drivers are examined. A partially automated driving system, as well as dual-mode cars which hook up to an electric rail roadway where computers take full control are demonstrated. Major considerations in the prototypes studied are safety, air pollution and traffic congestion. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Burton, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News

results.title: The Four day week
results.creator_credit: Gordon Hyatt, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses some issues related to work in the future-30 hour week, automatic unionism, early retirement. Also looks at some of the consequences of these ideas, especially the use of leisure and recreation facilities. Reported by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: What are we doing to our world
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses the serious changes in the ecology if many environments caused by industrial pollution, taking Lake Erie as an example. Oil, silt, sewage and various industrial wastes and pesticides have destroyed most of the lake’s fish. Also considers the effects of water and air pollution, including such problems as the “Greenhouse effect” from increased atmospheric carbon dioxide, which is influencing climate and the radioactive contamination arising from disposal of nuclear waste.
results.title_for_label: What are we doing to our world

Oil, silt, sewage and various industrial wastes and pesticides have destroyed most of the lake’s fish. Also considers the effects of water and air pollution, including such problems as the “Greenhouse effect” from increased atmospheric carbon dioxide, which is influencing climate and the radioactive contamination arising from disposal of nuclear waste.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: Tomorrow...today
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Examines the ways in which scientists simulate the future in order to solve tech;nological problems. Shows the lunar module of the Apollo project that landed on the moon, and demonstrates how the astronauts learned how to manoeuvre and land it. Also shows an airplane landing simulator, and a gymnast who simulates walking on the moon.

results.title: Autos and all that traffic
results.creator_credit: Jon Wilkman, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Presents all aspects of the situation, including: the problems traffic creates, air pollution, new cars to be developed, methods in accident prevention, and new highway planning. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Games futurists play
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
An examination of some of the methods humans are utilising in their search for knowledge of existing social problems as well as projected social problems of the future. This film introduces us to new games now being played to prepare us for tomorrow. As we witness three such games, we see that apart from their childish role-playing aspect they can be constructive also.
